ROLEPLAY SCRIPT:

You are experiencing the following symptoms:
- Swollen, tender lymph nodes on your neck
- A small bump or sore at the site of a scratch on your arm
- A mild fever that comes and goes
THESE SYMPTOMS CAME INTO FRUITION ABOUT TWO WEEKS AGO after you accidentally got scratched by your neighbor’s kitten while playing outside. The bump at the scratch site turned into a small pustule, and lately, your neck swelling has been bothering you, especially when you play or run around. You notice you feel a little tired and sometimes have a low-grade fever, but no other major symptoms. You’ve been around a lot of cats at home and see stray cats nearby often.

output:

I noticed a tiny bump at the scratch spot — it got kind of sore and turned into a little bump with a white part. Now, I have these swollen lumps on my neck that hurt a little more when I run or play, and I’ve been feeling kind of tired and sometimes I have a low fever, but not all the time. I’m not sure if it’s because of the scratch or the cats around my house.
